intro: Matelea araneosa, commonly known as the spider-moth plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white, often with a subtle fragrance. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Matelea araneosa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to xeriscaped gardens.
